page.title: 13FIRST SCHOOL EDUCATION BALBY
page.content: Our school was built in 1930. The mayor of the time Mr. Cookes opened it. There is a plaque to say so. The school is made of red brick and is a hollow rectangle. There are 18 classrooms. A typical classroom is square. Most classrooms have a blackboard on one wall, display frieze on the opposite wall and a sink unit. There is a carpeted area for a book corner. A third wall is mostly windows. The fourth wall is glass and looks onto the corridor. The corridors are 136 metres long with fire doors at each end. We have 2 rectangular halls used for assemblies and physical education. There are 12 teachers. In the middle of the school is a quadrangle with trees, grass and flowers. School hours are 8.55am to 3.30pm. Terms are Autumn, Spring and Summer. The children are 5 to 9 years.
